node.title: New exposure sites listed in Darwin, government criticised for press release updates
node.alt: A double-lane street lined with trees and a tall building on the left. A ute is driving away
node.description: Northern Territory health groups and the opposition are criticising the NT government for what they say is a lack of information about developments in the COVID-19 situation over the Christmas period.
node.content:
["A restaurant in the inner Darwin suburb of Stuart Park has been named a close contact exposure site, while people who visited venues from the CBD to the rural area have been advised to monitor for symptoms of\u00a0COVID-19.", "The government's exposure site list was updated on Monday night, with the Bamboo Lounge Restaurant in Stuart Park deemed a close contact exposure site for Tuesday,\u00a0December 21, from 7.20pm to 9.20pm.", "Anyone at the restaurant at that time is required to immediately self-quarantine and call the government's COVID-19 hotline and identify themselves as a close contact.", "A number of low risk contact sites have also been listed, including:", "Low risk close contacts are required to monitor for symptoms for 14 days and isolate and get tested if they become symptomatic.", "Updates to the list of current NT public exposure sites\u00a0can be found on the NT government's coronavirus\u00a0website.", "Posts about the update\u00a0on government social media pages did not say which COVID case or cases had visited the new exposure sites.\u00a0", "It comes as the NT government is under fire from health groups and the opposition for what they say is a lack of information about developments in the COVID-19 situation over the Christmas period.", "The government has issued brief updates via press release since the last press conference was held on Thursday last week.", "Interstate, governments scrambled to reinstate restrictions lifted before cases of the Omicron variant surged to new daily records and added crippling pressure to COVID testing systems.", "The NT government has not said how many Omicron cases are among the 32 interstate arrivals that have tested positive since border restrictions eased at the start of last week.", "In a statement issued on Monday, the NT government said the source of a coronavirus infection identified in Darwin was \"under investigation\".", "It did not say whether the case \u2014 a woman in her 60s \u2014 had been in the community while infectious.", "", "
A\u00a0Royal Darwin Hospital (RDH) worker\u00a0tested positive on Saturday, but no further details have been released.(ABC News: Che Chorley)
", "No further detail was given about a Royal Darwin Hospital (RDH) worker who tested positive on Saturday and who the government said was infectious in unknown locations in the community.", "New cases were announced over the weekend in the Katherine and Tennant Creek \"areas\" as well as in Yulara near Uluru, while positive wastewater results were detected in Nhulunbuy in north-east Arnhem Land on Saturday.", "Speaking to media on Monday, opposition health spokesman Bill Yan said the government was giving too little information about the changing situation.", "", "
Mr Yan said Territorians needed more information about the NT's COVID-19 outbreak.(ABC News: Chelsea Heaney)
", "\"We're at a point in time where we're having large amounts of cases crop up, in our communities and in our towns,\" he said.", "On Monday afternoon he said no explanation had been given for the lack of new exposure sites on the NT government's website despite the announcement of cases infectious while in the community.", "In response to questions from the ABC, an NT Health spokesperson said a new exposure location was only listed on the government's COVID-19 website when contacts at an exposure site cannot be found and public action was required.", "
Positive cases in hospital for \"infection control\"
", "Fifteen coronavirus patients are currently receiving treatment in NT hospitals, including one in the ICU, according to the NT government's latest statement.", "Since Saturday, the government's statements have said most cases in hospital were there for assessment and infection control purposes only, which has previously been handled through the transfer of cases and contacts to the Howard Springs quarantine facility.", "No detail has been given about the impact of the positive case recorded in the RDH staff member on staff numbers or operations at the hospital.", "In response to questions from the ABC about the impact on patients and visitors, a government spokesperson said \"routine assessment and screening process[es]\" are in place.", "Australian Nursing and Midwifery Federation NT (ANMF NT) branch secretary Cath Hatcher said she was surprised the NT government had not been holding public briefings.", "\"I would've thought [the government] would've done a presser [on Monday] as well as Friday, and just had the two days off with Christmas and Boxing Day,\" she said.", "", "
Ms Hatcher said many NT health workers were feeling overworked.(Supplied: ANMF)
", "She said staff shortages and overtime were affecting capacity at the Alice Springs and Tennant Creek hospital, where a number of the cases announced in recent days had been taken.", "Australian Medical Association NT (AMA NT) president Robert Parker said he was also concerned about the limited detail being released.", "\"It's always better for public morale for authority figures to actually inform the public, so I think would be better for the government to have a press conference,\" he said.", "", "
Dr Parker called for more details about the outbreak to be released.(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "
Low testing rate in Nhulunbuy after positive wastewater
", "In Monday's statement, the government said people in Nhulunbuy were encouraged to come forward for testing.", "In response to questions from the ABC, a spokesperson said 35 COVID tests were taken in the town of around 3,000 people after the wastewater results were announced on the weekend.", "A major testing site in Darwin \u2014 the Marrara drive-through clinic \u2014 reopened on Monday after it was forced to close because of storms on the weekend.\u00a0", "Under changes announced last week, interstate arrivals are now only required to take a rapid antigen test on their third and sixth days in the NT rather than a PCR test.", "Yesterday the ACT announced it would close two major testing sites to people who were seeking a PCR test to travel interstate, to prioritise patients who were more likely to have COVID-19.", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test
"]
